results.title: Britain's sporting heritage
results.brief_description: A montage of favourite sporting events in Britain. Athletics, tennis, skating, golf and cycling; team games including soccer and rugby, cricket and hockey. Famous sporting personalities and some young champions of the future in action.

results.title: Britain's new resources
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “This Is Britain”.
A brief study of the uses to which Britain is putting her limited natural resources; the harvesting, scientific drying, and storing of short grass for feeding cattle all the year round; the planting of forests and cutting of timber; harnessing of hydro-electric power; soap manufacture without fats; the use of seaweed in the manufacture of many products; production of magnesium from the waters of the North Sea.

results.title: Bristol: British city
results.creator_credit: Mary Francis, Alexander Shaw and World Wide Pictures
results.brief_description: The people of Bristol tell of their city, long since called the Maritime Capital of the West of England; a city with whose history many pioneers, adventurers and navigators, and many great moral and spiritual leaders have been associated. With its bustling life and half a million citizens, the city’s efficiency is still symbolised by the old phrase “shipshape and Bristol fashion”.

results.title: Bristol fashion
results.creator_credit: Eric Fullilove, Terry Ashwood and Associated British-Pathe
results.brief_description: The history and development of the Port of Bristol - the only major municipally owned port in Britain. Illustrates the facilities available in the city docks and at Avonmouth and Portishead, and discusses plans for the expansion of dock services. Sequences on the history of architecture of Bristol are interwoven.

results.title: Briefing
results.creator_credit: Seven Dimensions and Victorian Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Working together”.
Discussion starter looking at the problem of an individual receiving information from a group. Three executives are briefing a new designer and digress to such an extent that at the end of the briefing the designer still has to ask what the product was. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Bridgit
results.brief_description: The 32 minute work by Scottish artist Charlotte Prodger won the 2018 Turner Prize, and explores themes of class, gender, sexuality and neolithic goddesses.

constellations_other.description: Looking at the use of handycams and other consumer level devices in moving image works.

results.title: Bridging the G.A.P.
results.creator_credit: Robert Rothols and Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture
results.brief_description: A promotional film showing the get-together in Victoria of gold awardees in the Duke of Edinburgh scheme. Depicts the community services carried out by the young people during their stay in Victoria.

results.title: Bridget Riley
results.creator_credit: David Thompson, Arts Council of Great Britain and Balfour Films
results.brief_description: A profile of artist, Bridget Riley. Explores the inspirations she draws from the visual experiences in nature and follows her into her studio where she organises and activates her paintings. Credits include A.A. Englander (photographer) and Roy Ayton (editor).

results.title: Bridges in Holland
results.creator_credit: Rolf Orthel, Bert Haanstra and Bert Haanstra Film Productions
results.brief_description: A tribute to Holland’s bridge builders; a beautifully photographed study of the texture and structure of bridges to present a view of Holland in all seasons in all parts. The assembly of shots of bridges from opening ceremonies to demolition tell their own story without commentary. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
